prompt: <description><part\\_1> - A Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. **Create a new coordinate system** ```json "coordinate_system": { "Euler Angles": [ 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 ], "Translation Vector": [ 0.0, 0.75, 0.0 ] } ``` 2. **Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** ```json "sketch": { "face_1": { "loop_1": { "line_1": { "Start Point": [ 0.0, 0.0 ], "End Point": [ 0.0592, 0.0 ] }, "line_2": { "Start Point": [ 0.0592, 0.0 ], "End Point": [ 0.0592, 0.2763 ] }, "line_3": { "Start Point": [ 0.0592, 0.2763 ], "End Point": [ 0.0, 0.2763 ] }, "line_4": { "Start Point": [ 0.0, 0.2763 ], "End Point": [ 0.0, 0.0 ] } } } } ``` The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with one loop (loop\\_1) containing four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4). 3. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Use the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] as mentioned in the coordinate system definition to create the 3D sketch. 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** ```json "extrusion": { "extrude_depth_towards_normal": 0.75, "extrude_depth_opposite_normal": 0.0, "sketch_scale": 0.2763, "operation": "NewBodyFeatureOperation" } ``` Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.75 units towards the normal and with no extrusion in the opposite direction. Apply the scaling factor of 0.2763 to the sketch as per the sketch\\_scale property. The final part will be a rectangular prism with dimensions as provided in the description section: - Height: 0.2763 units - Width: 0.75 units - Length: 0.2763 units</description>

Use the provided Euler angles and translation vector in the "coordinate\\_system" property. 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 2. Construct a rectangle defined by the following lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0, 0], End Point [0.75, 0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0], End Point [0.75, 0.2679] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.2679], End Point [0.2679, 0.2679] * Line 4: Start Point [0.2679, 0.2679], End Point [0.2679, 0.5893] * Line 5: Start Point [0.2679, 0.5893], End Point [0, 0.5893] * Line 6: Start Point [0, 0.5893], End Point [0, 0] Close the loop to create the rectangular face. **Extrusion and Assembly** Using the provided parameters in the "extrusion" property, perform the following operations: 1. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75, in accordance with the "sketch\\_scale" parameter. 2. Extrude the scaled sketch towards the positive Z-direction by 0.0268 (the "extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal" value). 3. Set the operation of this part relative to the previous body using one of the following descriptions: * If there is no previous body, this operation will create a new solid body. * If there is a previous body, this operation will add material to the existing body. **Description of Final Shape** The resulting shape is a rectangular prism with a height of 0.0268, a width of 0.75, and a length of 0.75.</description>

Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch by rotating it using the euler angles and translating it using the translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch with the following properties: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.1875 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - sketch\\_scale: 0.75 - operation: Create a new solid body The final dimensions of this part are: - length: 0.75 - width: 0.75 - height: 0.75 + 0.1875 = 0.9375 Part 2 Construct two offset cylinders with a flat top and bottom, positioned diagonally from each other, on a common base. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0469, 0.0938, 0.0094] Next, create a 2D sketch containing two faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2) and circles on each face: - face\\_1 - loop\\_1 - circle\\_1: Center [0.0469, 0.0469], Radius 0.0469 - face\\_2 (make sure it's parallel to face\\_1 and mirrored across the X axis) - loop\\_1 - circle\\_1: Center [0.2344, 0.0469], Radius 0.0469 Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.2812. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch by rotating it using the euler angles and translating it using the translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch with the following properties: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0937 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - sketch\\_scale: 0.2812 - operation: Add materials to the existing body The final dimensions of this part are: - length (distance between the two circles): approximately 0.2812 \\* 2 = 0.5625 - width (distance between the center of the two circles): 0.0937 - height: 0.2812</description>
